required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 13, 2016
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: SH L 562BB Phase II/III Dose Justification and Gadoteridol-controlled Comparative Study
clinical_study.official_title: Multi-center, Randomized, Controlled, Single-blind, Intra-individual Comparisons of 2 Dose of Gadobutrol 1.0 Molar and Gadoteridol (ProHance) Crossover Studies With Corresponding Blinded Image Evaluation Following Multiple Injections of 0.1 mmol/kg bw of Gadobutrol and Gadoteridol in Patients With Known or Suspected Brain Metastasis

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare

brief_summary.textblock: This study is conducted to compare the contrast effect and safety of SH L562BB with ProHance, which has already been approved as a pharmaceutical product of similar indication.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Diagnostic

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Lesions Detected by Blinded Readers (BR) and Investigator
primary_outcome.description: Number of metastatic lesions (unenhanced and enhanced) per participant detected on postcontrast Magnetic resonance (MR) images by averaged blinded reader and investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: Score of Visibility Assessment - Degree of Lesion Contrast Enhancement by Blinded Reader
secondary_outcome.description: Degree of contrast enhancement for each lesion on postcontrast MR images using the 4-point scale by averaged blinded reader (Score 1=No, 2=Moderate, 3=Good, 4=Excellent)

secondary_outcome.measure: Score of Visibility Assessment - Degree of Lesion Contrast Enhancement by Investigator
secondary_outcome.description: Degree of contrast enhancement for each lesion on postcontrast MR images using the 4-point scale by investigator (Score 1=No, 2=Moderate, 3=Good, 4=Excellent)

secondary_outcome.measure: Score of Visibility Assessment - Border Delineation by Blinded Reader
secondary_outcome.description: Border delineation for each lesion on postcontrast MR images using the 4-point scale by averaged blinded reader (Score 1=None, 2=Moderate, 3=Good, 4=Excellent)

secondary_outcome.measure: Score of Visibility Assessment - Border Delineation by Investigator
secondary_outcome.description: Border delineation for each lesion on postcontrast MR images using the 4-point scale by investigator (Score 1=None, 2=Moderate, 3=Good, 4=Excellent)

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Planning Confidence - Gadobutrol 0.1 mmol/kg bw vs. Gadoteridol (ProHance) 0.2 mmol/kg bw by Treatment Planning Experts (TPE)
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment planning confidence evaluated separately for each image set (gadobutrol [Gado-] 0.1 mmol/kg bw and gadoteridol [Pro-] 0.2 mmol/kg) by TPE (category: not confident, confident, and not assessable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Planning Confidence - Gadobutrol 0.1 mmol/kg bw vs. Gadoteridol (ProHance) 0.2 mmol/kg bw by Investigator
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment planning confidence evaluated separately for each image set (gadobutrol 0.1 mmol/kg bw and gadoteridol 0.2 mmol/kg) by investigator (category: not confident, confident, and not assessable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Planning Confidence - Gadobutrol 0.2 mmol/kg bw vs. Gadoteridol (ProHance) 0.2 mmol/kg bw by TPE
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment planning confidence evaluated separately for each image set (gadobutrol 0.2 mmol/kg bw and gadoteridol 0.2 mmol/kg) by TPE (category: not confident, confident, and not assessable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Planning Confidence - Gadobutrol 0.2 mmol/kg bw vs. Gadoteridol (ProHance) 0.2 mmol/kg bw by Investigator
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment planning confidence evaluated separately for each image set (gadobutrol 0.2 mmol/kg bw and gadoteridol 0.2 mmol/kg) by investigator (category: not confident, confident, and not assessable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Performance in Stereotactic Radiosurgery (SRS) Planning by TPE
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of overall image quality for SRS treatment planning between gadobutrol and gadoteridol by TPE

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Performance in Stereotactic Radiosurgery (SRS) Planning by Investigator
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of overall image quality for SRS treatment planning between gadobutrol and gadoteridol by investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Reasons for Performance in SRS Planning by TPE
secondary_outcome.description: Reasons for comparison results of overall image quality for SRS treatment planning between gadobutrol and gadoteridol by investigator (multiple answers applicable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Reasons for Performance in SRS Planning by Investigator
secondary_outcome.description: Reasons for comparison results of overall image quality for SRS treatment planning between gadobutrol and gadoteridol by investigator (multiple answers applicable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Lesion Size Evaluated by Independent Radiologist
secondary_outcome.description: Size of each lesion on postcontrast MR images evaluated by independent radiologist (mean and standard deviation of 603 lesions)

secondary_outcome.measure: Contrast Noise Ratio (CNR) of Lesions Evaluated by Independent Radiologist
secondary_outcome.description: CNR of lesion/normal white matter based on the signal intensity of MR images evaluated by independent radiologist (mean and standard deviation of 306 lesions)

secondary_outcome.measure: Intraclass Correlation Coefficient (ICC) Among 3 Blinded Readers on the Number of Detected Lesions
secondary_outcome.description: ICC among 3 blinded readers calculated for number of detected lesions using the statistical model with two random effects, i.e., blinded readers and individual patients.

arm_group.description: Participants received first injection (intravenous [i.v.]) of gadobutrol 0.1 mmol/kg body weight (bw), corresponding to a dose of 0.1 mmol/kg bw
Participants received second injection (i.v.) of gadobutrol 0.1 mmol/kg bw, corresponding to a total dose of 0.2 mmol/kg bw. The interval of two bolus injections is 13-15 min
Participants received two injections (i.v.) of gadoteridol 0.1 mmol/kg bw, corresponding to a total dose of 0.2 mmol/kg bw. The interval of two bolus injections is 13-15 min

intervention.description: Gadobutrol enhanced MRI (first injection of gadobutrol 0.1 mmol/kg bw, corresponding to a dose of 0.1 mmol/kg bw)
Gadobutrol enhanced MRI (second injection of gadobutrol 0.1 mmol/kg bw, corresponding to a total dose of 0.2 mmol/kg bw)
ProHance enhanced MRI (two injections of gadoteridol 0.1 mmol/kg bw, corresponding to a total dose of 0.2 mmol/kg bw)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Japanese patients at least 20 years of age
- Patients with diagnosed primary cancer
- Patients with metastatic lesions by CT/MRI
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have contraindication to the MRI examinations
- Patients who have severe renal disorder
- Patients in extremely serious general condition

facility.name: University of Occupational and Environmental Health
Institute of Biomedical Research and Innovation
Osaka Pre. Medical Center for Resp. and Allergic Diseases

link.description: Click here and search for drug information provided by the FDA.
Click here and search for information on any recalls, market or product safety alerts by the FDA which might have occurred with this product.

results_reference.citation: Katakami N, Inaba Y, Sugata S, Tsurusaki M, Itoh T, Machida T, Tanaka H, Nakayama T, Morikawa T, Breuer J, Aitoku Y. Magnetic resonance evaluation of brain metastases from systemic malignances with two doses of gadobutrol 1.0 m compared with gadoteridol: a multicenter, phase ii/iii study in patients with known or suspected brain metastases. Invest Radiol. 2011 Jul;46(7):411-8. doi: 10.1097/RLI.0b013e3182145a6c.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 175 participants were enrolled into the study. 10 were withdrawn from the study before entering Study Period 1. Safety Analysis Set included 164 participants; gadobutrol=161, ProHance=162. Per Protocol Set (PPS) included 151 participants.

group.title: Gadobutrol Then Gadoteridol
group.description: Participants who received two injections of gadobutrol 0.1 mmol/kg body weight (bw) in Period 1, and two injections of gadoteridol 0.1 mmol/kg bw in Period 2

group.title: Gadoteridol Then Gadobutrol
group.description: Participants who received two injections of gadoteridol 0.1 mmol/kg body weight (bw) in Period 1, and two injections of gadobutrol 0.1 mmol/kg bw in Period 2

group.title: Entire Study Population
group.description: includes all participants received treatment

outcome.title: Number of Lesions Detected by Blinded Readers (BR) and Investigator
outcome.description: Number of metastatic lesions (unenhanced and enhanced) per participant detected on postcontrast Magnetic resonance (MR) images by averaged blinded reader and investigator
outcome.population: Participants without a major protocol deviation or conditions that could affect his or her efficacy evaluation (Per Protocol Set), with valid data for this Outcome Measure.

group.description: Participants received two injections (i.v.) of gadoteridol 0.1 mmol/kg bw, corresponding to a total dose of 0.2 mmol/kg bw. The interval of two bolus injections is 13-15 min

category.sub_title: Gadobutrol was better: newly detected lesions
Gadobutrol was better: lesion size exceeds limit
Gadobutrol was better: extended radiation area
Gadobutrol was better: clarified radiation area
ProHance was better: newly detected lesions
ProHance was better: lesion size exceeds the limit
ProHance was better: newly treatable lesions
ProHance was better: extended radiation area
ProHance was better: clarified radiation area

measure.description: CNR of lesion/normal white matter based on the signal intensity of MR images evaluated by independent radiologist (mean and standard deviation of 306 lesions)

outcome.title: Intraclass Correlation Coefficient (ICC) Among 3 Blinded Readers on the Number of Detected Lesions
outcome.description: ICC among 3 blinded readers calculated for number of detected lesions using the statistical model with two random effects, i.e., blinded readers and individual patients.
outcome.population: Participants without a major protocol deviation or conditions that could affect his or her efficacy evaluation (Per Protocol Set), with valid data for this Outcome Measure.

group.title: Gadobutrol 0.1 mmol/kg bw
group.description: Participants received first injection (intravenous [i.v.]) of gadobutrol 0.1 mmol/kg body weight (bw), corresponding to a dose of 0.1 mmol/kg bw

group.title: Gadobutrol 0.2 mmol/kg bw
group.description: Participants received second injection (i.v.) of gadobutrol 0.1 mmol/kg bw, corresponding to a total dose of 0.2 mmol/kg bw. The interval of two bolus injections is 13-15 min

group.title: Gadoteridol (ProHance) 0.2mmol/kg bw
group.description: Participants received two injections (i.v.) of gadoteridol 0.1 mmol/kg bw, corresponding to a total dose of 0.2 mmol/kg bw. The interval of two bolus injections is 13-15 min

measure.title: Intraclass Correlation Coefficient (ICC) Among 3 Blinded Readers on the Number of Detected Lesions
measure.description: ICC among 3 blinded readers calculated for number of detected lesions using the statistical model with two random effects, i.e., blinded readers and individual patients.

group.title: Gadobutrol Period
group.description: Participants received two injections (i.v.) of gadobutrol 0.1 mmol/kg bw, corresponding to a total dose of 0.2 mmol/kg bw.

group.title: ProHance Period
group.description: Participants received two injections (i.v.) of gadoteridol 0.1 mmol/kg bw, corresponding to a total dose of 0.2 mmol/kg bw.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
